name: Ring Stand
use:
Supports the bunsen burner, iron ring, pipestem
triangle, and other items, often while heating a
substance.

name: Pipestem Triangle
use:
Supports the crucible when being heated over an
open flame

name: Evaporating Dish
use:
Used to evaporate excess solvents to create a more
concentrated solution.

name: Test Tubes
use:
Holds small amounts of liquids for mixing or
heating.

name: Beaker
use: Holding water (also used to heat liquids)

name: Erlenmeyer Flask
use:
Narrow-mouthed container used to transport, heat,
or store substance. Often used when a stopper is
required.

name: Volumetric Flask
use:
Flask calibrated to contain a precise volume at a
particular temperature. Used for precise dilutions
and creating standard solutions.

name: Watch glass
use: Keeping liquid contents in a beaker from splattering

name: Mortar & Pestle
use: Used to grind chemicals to powder

name: Iron Ring
use: Supports a beaker over a bunsen burner. Wire gauze is usually placed on top of this structure.

name: Utility Clamp
use: Used to hold a test tube or other piece of equipment in place on a ring stand.

name: Wire Gauze
use: Suspending glassware over the Bunsen burner

name: Tongs
use: Transport a hot beaker; remove lid from crucible.

name: Triple-Beam Balance
use: Obtaining the mass of an object

name: Test Tube Clamp
use: Heating contents in a test tube

name: Bunsen Burner
use: Bunsen burner Heating (flame-safe) contents in the lab

name: Forceps
use:
Used in dissection to grasp tissues or pick up small
items.

name: File
use: Used to grind down materials or sharpen items.

name: Wire Brush
use:
Used to clean the inside of test tubes or graduated
cylinders

name: Test Tube Rack
use:
Holding many test tubes filled with chemicals (or
for drying after washing)

name: Funnel
use:
Used to pour liquids into containers with small
openings; also used to hold filter paper

name: Scoopula
use: Scooping solids/powders.

name: Graduated Cylinder
use: Measuring specific amounts of liquids (65 mL)

name: Spatula
use:
Measuring/removing small amounts of solids or
powders (often when obtaining mass)

name: Wash Bottle
use:
Used to wash down specific pieces of equipment
with water or keep materials moist.

name: Micropipets
use:
Used to measure and dispence very small amounts
of liquids. (ex. 0.5 mL)

name: Buret
use:
Measuring specific amounts of liquids (often
determining amounts of acids or bases needed) (ex.
13 mL); releasing small amounts of acids or bases
into other solutions.

name: Dropper
use:
Used to obtain small amounts of liquids (not
precise)

name: Thermometer
use: Used to measure temperature

name: Pipet
use:
Used to measure and dispense small amounts of
liquids (ex. 1 mL)

name: Well Plate
use:
Mixing very small amounts of chemicals together
and comparing results.

name: Corks
use: Used to seal or stop flasks or test tubes.

name: Hot Plate
use: Used for consistent heat; used to heat substances that may be flammable.

name: Florence Flask
use:
Flask with a round body and flat bottom. Used to
hold and heat liquids.
